Title: Brazilian students and teachers join marches against Bolsonaro
Description: Nationwide protests pits rightwing president against defiant student body

Title: Brazil Economy Heads for Contraction in Setback to Bolsonaro
Description: Brazil’s economy shrank in the first quarter, a key central bank activity index showed, dealing a setback to President Jair Bolsonaro’s pledge to accelerate the country’s recovery.

Title: Brazil's Bolsonaro Sees a Star Rise in Controversy-Hit Cabinet
Description: In the first few months of President Jair Bolsonaro’s government, his cabinet delivered more than its fair share of controversy, infighting and slow starts. For investors, Brazil’s new infrastructure ministry stands out as a notable exception.

Title: Brazil and US hit restart button on trade relations
Description: Officials are optimistic but rivalry in agriculture could hinder any potential deal

Title: Brazil’s rickety infrastructure primed for investment
Description: Experts discuss how Bolsonaro’s free-market reforms could benefit transport

Title: New Trade Routes: US-Brazil
Description: US president Donald Trump and his Brazilian counterpart Jair Bolsonaro — both disruptive, first-time presidents — recently pledged to strengthen economic ties between the two countries. We analyse the possibilities and challenges this presents

Title: Brazil Tells the World: The Amazon Rainforest Is Ours, Not Yours
Description: Managing the world’s largest rainforest is a Brazilian affair and foreigners should stop meddling in the Amazon, President Jair Bolsonaro’s top security adviser said in an interview.

Title: Brazil’s Ronaldo on owning a club, fame and playing under Berlusconi
Description: The legendary striker on a life in the sport — and the dramas of the 1998 World Cup final

Title: Cryptocurrency regulation gets the go-ahead in Brazil
Description: Brazil’s move towards cryptocurrency regulation took a step closer this month as the government in Brasilia agreed and published ‘instruction 1888’. The instruction passes new rules that come into force on August 1, meaning that individuals, legal entities and brokerage firms that carry out operations

Title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro keeps it in the family
Description: The president trusts few people and so with his sons is building a dynasty in Latin America’s largest nation
